content:
TITLE: Running Tests in Noda Time with .NET SDK
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the tests for the Noda Time project using the .NET SDK. It runs all tests in the `src/NodaTime.Test` directory and reports the results. This ensures the code changes are working as expected and haven't introduced any regressions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nodatime/nodatime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
dotnet test src/NodaTime.Test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Noda Time Solution with .NET SDK
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the Noda Time solution using the .NET SDK. It compiles the code and prepares it for testing or deployment. It assumes the .NET SDK is installed and configured in your environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nodatime/nodatime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
dotnet build src/NodaTime.sln
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a New Branch with Git
DESCRIPTION: This sequence of Git commands creates a new branch off the `main` branch. It first checks out the `main` branch, pulls the latest changes from the `upstream` remote, and then creates and checks out a new branch named `SOME-BRANCH-NAME`. Replace `SOME-BRANCH-NAME` with a descriptive name for your branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nodatime/nodatime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
git checkout main
git pull upstream main
git checkout -b SOME-BRANCH-NAME
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Noda Time Repository with Git
DESCRIPTION: Clones the Noda Time repository from GitHub to your local machine. Replace `YOUR-USERNAME` with your GitHub username. This creates a local copy of the repository for development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nodatime/nodatime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/nodatime.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Upstream Remote for Noda Time Repository
DESCRIPTION: Adds a remote named `upstream` pointing to the original Noda Time repository on GitHub. This allows you to fetch updates from the main repository. It's a common practice to keep your fork synchronized with the original repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nodatime/nodatime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
git remote add upstream https://github.com/nodatime/nodatime.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing a Branch to Origin with Git
DESCRIPTION: Publishes a local Git branch to your forked repository (origin) on GitHub.  `-u` sets up tracking, so future `git pull` and `git push` commands will work without specifying the remote and branch.  Replace `MY-BRANCH-NAME` with the actual branch name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nodatime/nodatime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
git push origin -u MY-BRANCH-NAME
```
